@@Arthur-Lenny-Morgan That comment is referring to a signature production technique often used by Drake and his longtime producer, 40. In many of Drakeâ€™s songs, especially during emotional or introspective moments, the beat will strip down to just atmospheric elements or accentuate certain sounds, creating a â€œmutedâ€ or minimalistic bridge before dropping back into the full beat. Metro Boomin is known for his layered, cinematic production, but in Like That, thereâ€™s a moment where the instrumental is stripped down, emphasizing the beat in a way that mimics Drakeâ€™s style. The commenter is likely implying that Metro is subtly mocking or â€œdissingâ€ Drake by using one of his own signature production moves against him, reinforcing the ongoing feud between Drake and Metro/Future/Kendrick. Itâ€™s a way of saying, â€œWe can do your style, but betterâ€”and use it against you.â€
